derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Old French deceptif, -ive or late Latin deceptivus, from decept- 'deceived', from decipere 'to deceive'

entry.def: If something is deceptive, it encourages you to believe something which is not true.

means.word_mean: 1. causing one to believe what is not true or fail to believe what is true;
2. tending to deceive or mislead either deliberately or inadvertently;

sentences.sentence: "the deceptive calm in the eye of the storm"
"statistics can be presented in ways that are misleading"

auth_sentence.content: It is an altogether deceptive occupation in my view.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is an altogether deceptive occupation in my view.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is an altogether deceptive occupation in my view.

auth_sentence.content: But, according to Professor Mousseau, appearances are deceptive.
auth_sentence.res_content: But, according to Professor Mousseau, appearances are deceptive.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But, according to Professor Mousseau, appearances are deceptive.

auth_sentence.content: These groups are clever marketers and masters of deceptive PR.
auth_sentence.res_content: These groups are clever marketers and masters of deceptive PR.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: These groups are clever marketers and masters of deceptive PR.

stems_affixes.word_buile: de坏+cept拿,抓,握住+ive……的→拿坏的东西来→欺骗性的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 易受感染的,易受影响的
stems_affixes.word_buile: sus下+cept拿+ible能……的→能被[病]拿下→易受影响
con共同+cept拿,抓,握住→共同把握→共同的想法→观念,概念
in进入+cept拿,抓,握住+ion动作或状态→开始拿住→开端
per全部+cept拿,抓,握住+ion状态→全部抓住→理解;感知
pre预先+cept拿,抓,握住→预先拿好的话→箴言
re再+ceipt=cept抓→再次拿到→得到的收据
re再+cept拿,抓,握住+acle东西→拿东西的东西→容器
ac再+cept拿,抓,握住→一再拿→接受

means.word_mean: 可能欺骗的, 导致误解的

jushi.english: He said at last, with deceptive quiet.
jushi.chinese: 他终于开了口，故作镇静。

jushi.english: My first impression of him was deceptive—he was older than he looked.
jushi.chinese: 他给我的第一印象具有虚假性——他实际上比看上去老。

jushi.english: The first physical impression was deceptive.
jushi.chinese: 初次接触，外貌给人的印象未必正确。
